history.content:
I recommend CS 188 or Philos 12A for your third class. 170 is great for internships. Imo 61c and 188 don't help too much for internships, but are useful classes.

CS170 + 61c is quite difficult (although it is a popular combo). 

Different anon- In order of usefulness for internships, it goes 170 > 61C > 188. This is because 61C teaches you low-level programming/C, and quite a few jobs require that you know it (or C++). There are also a lot of concepts that are relevant if you're going for software internships, like cacheing and parallelization. However, 170 and 61C together will be hard and unless you think you can handle it, I'd say not to do it. 170 has weekly problemsets (~10-15 hours), and 61C has projects pretty regularly (on the order of small-medium 61B projects). This is because you won't get to engage with the 170 material as intensely. I didn't take 170 with 61C, but took it with another hard upper-div stats course, and felt I didn't understand it as well as I should have. Depending on whatever suits you- if you like programming and want to balance out your CS/Philosophy load, then 188 might be nice, or if you're really into philosophy, go for 12A.

I recommend CS 188 or Philos 12A for your third class. 170 is great for internships. Imo 61c and 188 don't help too much for internships, but are useful classes.



CS170 + 61c is quite difficult (although it is a popular combo).

I recommend CS 188 or Philos 12A for your third class. 170 is great for internships. Imo 61c and 188 don't help too much for internships, but are useful classes nevertheless. 

CS170 + 61c is quite difficult (although it is a popular combo).

I recommend CS 188 or Philos 12A for your third class.

CS170 + 61c is quite difficult (although it is a popular combo).

Just finished my first semester of sophomore year, where I took CS 70 and some easier courses. Looking now to take CS 170 and CS 61C, but picking up a double major in Philosophy, so will be taking at minimum 2 Philosophy courses.

Current schedule for next semester is CS 170, Philosophy 3, and Philosophy 25B. For my third class, I'm debating between CS 61C, CS 188, and Philosophy 12A (Logic - considering this because I've just taken CS 70).

Does anyone have input on the difficulty of a courseload with CS 170, CS 61C, and 2 Philosophy (lot of writing) classes? Would it be more manageable to take CS 188 in lieu of 61C? What would be optimal for internships and industry work? Super unfamiliar and don't know which of the three options to pick - for context, I've gotten a B+ in all the intro CS classes, but didn't put too much time into CS 70 and kinda crammed for everything - plan to put much more work into 170 and the other classes I'd be taking ideally.
history.subject: CS Class to take with CS 170
